name: tent
content:

B1 a shelter made of canvas or a similar material and supported by poles and ropes, that you can fold up and carry with you
Andy Crawford/Dorling Kindersley/GettyImages
Examples
How does it feel to be back in civilization after all those weeks in a tent?Rain had dampened the tent so we left it to dry in the afternoon sun.Outside the tent I could hear the constant drone of insects.We thought we'd insure against rain by putting a tent up where people could take shelter.We pitched our tent in the shade.

to make something form a shape that is raised in the middle, like a tent: Cover the pan with aluminium foil that you have tented to allow for steam. He tented his fingers and rested his chin on them.
to cover something with a tent or similar structure: Crews were hurriedly tenting the red carpet. The house has been tented and sprayed with insecticide. After the concert, guests went into the garden which had been completely tented over for supper.
